|Title=Knowing the tests to be carried out for the aetiological diagnosis of urinary lithiasis
|Description=First-line metabolic test according to the recommendations of the urolithiasis committee

|Contributors=Romain Boissier

The first-line metabolic work-up recommended by the Lithiasis Committee of the Association Française d'Urologie includes :

* morphological and infrared analysis (Infrared SpectroPhotometry: SPIR) of the stone or fragments to determine the molecular and crystalline composition of the stone,
* a metabolic assessment on :
** fresh morning urine sample: crystalluria, pH, specific gravity, BU
** 24-hour urine analysis: total volume, creatinine, calcium, sodium, urea, urates,
** blood analysis: creatinine, calcium, fasting blood sugar, uricemia.

question.title: What is the first-line metabolic work-up recommended for the aetiological diagnosis of urinary lithiasis?

option_a.title: Urine culture and microscopy
option_a.description: A test to check for bacterial infection or the presence of germs

option_b.title: Infrared SpectroPhotometry (SPIR) of the stone or fragments
option_b.description: A test to determine the molecular and crystalline composition of the stone

option_c.title: 24-hour urine analysis and blood analysis
option_c.description: A test to check for various parameters such as creatinine, calcium, and uricemia

option_d.title: Imaging studies such as CT or MRI
option_d.description: A test to visualize the urinary tract and detect stones or other abnormalities

correct_option.title: Infrared SpectroPhotometry (SPIR) of the stone or fragments
